findings.Lower Thorax: Atelectasis or scarring at the right lung base. No pericardial effusion. Tiny bilateral pleural effusions.
findings.Liver: Nodular contour compatible with cirrhosis. No evidence of steatosis.
findings.Biliary: No intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The common bile duct measures 7 mm. No intraductal filling defects. Gallstones in the gallbladder but without gallbladder wall thickening.
findings.Pancreas: Normal T1 signal intensity. 7 mm cystic lesion in the pancreatic head/uncinate process. No pancreatic ductal dilatation. Mild retroperitoneal edema surrounding the pancreas.
findings.Kidneys: Enhance symmetrically. No hydronephrosis. Multiple small T2 hyperintense foci likely small renal cysts. 2.6 x 1.6 cm T2 hypointense lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney appears stable in size.
findings.Gastrointestinal Tract: Visualized portions appear within normal limits.
findings.Lymph Nodes: Prominent lymph nodes in porta hepatis likely related to chronic liver disease.
findings.Vasculature: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Prominent varices and recanalized periumbilical vein noted.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The 2.6 x 1.6 cm T2 hypointense lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney appears stable in size going back to ___.
